result.execSummary:
The defendant Monica S Brown was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Monica S Brown is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Monica S Brown was found guilty of Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Defendant may receive expunction after 2 years if no new law violations, Judgment fully satisfied, and probation successfully completed
Defendant to undergo anger management counseling, maintain full time employment/schooling, 6 month probation review hearing to be conducted

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Defendant Monica S Brown in court with attorney Leonie Dolch.  Troy D Cross appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Rights/Elements, Defendant pleads no contest to Ct. 1 and Ct. 3 in 15 CM 118 and Ct. 1 in 15 CM 125, Judgment to be entered, Ct. 2 in 15 CM 118 and Ct. 2 in 15 CM 125 dismissed, 15 CM 118, Ct. 1, Ct. 3, 15 CM 125, Ct. 1, Court withholds sentence, probation 2 years, concurrent, 15 CM 118, Ct. 1, $443.00 costs, anger management counseling, maintain full time employment/schooling, may receive expunction after 2 years if no new law violations, judgment fully satisfied, and probation successfully completed, 6 month probation review, Ct. 3, $243.00 costs, anger management counseling, maintain full time employment/schooling, may receive expunction after 2 years if no new law violations, judgment fully satisfied, and probation successfully completed, 6 month probation review, 4 days sentence credit, 15 CM 125, Ct. 1, $443.00 costs, anger management counseling, maintain full time employment/schooling, may receive expunction after 2 years if no new law violations, judgment fully satisfied, and probation successfully completed, 6 month probation review hearing, defendant to report to probation and parole by Noon today, cash bond to be applied towards costs
